name: Stirling House Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for....quiet location, waterfront view, within a street block to the center of town, a large porch with comfy seating for sipping wine, fantastic ample breakfasts, coffee, tea,soft drinks, homemade cookies and a candy jar and refer use at your disposal....clean spacious updated rooms designed for comfort and large immaculate bathrooms....and a friendly but unintrusive host who provides anything you need with a smile - then you got it here at Stiring B&B.
reviews.title: Great choice in Greenport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my third trip to Stirling House and I always feel like I am staying at the home of a friend or family member. Clay is the perfect host and very attentive to your every need. The breakfasts are always ample and delicious. The rooms and views are wonderful and Greenport is a great place to stay. From there you can explore both the North and South Forks on LI. We already booked our 2010 trip!
reviews.title: Stirling House is like a dear friend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This pretty and comfortable Bed & Breakfast offered everything we needed and more. Spotlessly clean, and plenty of space, every detail was considered. Breakfasts were lovely on the porch with the view and heater (it was October on Long Island) and Clay (proprietor) was very helpful and always available. On Saturday evening we had complimentary wine and cheese-lovely! The location was ideal as you can walk to everything in Greenport-a whole range of great restaurants, galleries, shops etc. The wine tasting was great too! We will definitely be coming back.
reviews.title: Great location and hospitality, clean and comfortable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clay made stay comfortable and was most helpful with restaurant suggestions and reservations as well as information on the local winerys. Small inn with big heart. We will be back.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable room with the most friendly service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Larry & Ellen
reviews.title: Great Location and Atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We needed some real rest and relaxation and couldn't have picked a better place.
reviews.title: Incredibly relaxing. Friendly and helpful hosts. Will definitely go again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners made it clear that their main concern was our happiness. I only had one pair of shorts, which I managed to get dirty. They were washed an dried in no time. There was a beautiful view of the water from the front porch with lots of and peace and quiet.. We stayed in the French room on the ground floor. Beautifully decorated, with a little sitting room that is separate from the bedroom with a sliding door between them (Great if one of you stays up late and the other doesn't) . Also, the fridge and coffee were right outside our door. The gourmet breakfasts were beautifully presented and delicious. They make the same thing for everybody, so tell them if there is something you don't like to eat. To their credit, they do ask if you have any food allergies.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience in Greenport, NY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great B & B. The owner Clay is so accomodating and funny. And what a cook! His breakfasts are not to be missed, multiple courses! The Stirling House is very charming with a great water view. The place is immaculate too. My partner and I had a very romantic stay at the Stirling House. Its also one of the best located B & Bs in Greenport because it's such a short walk to downtown action. Highly Recommended!!!
reviews.title: Can't beat the location
the perfect getaway
reviews.text: We stayed one night in the Stirling House and one night at the Bartlett House because neither place had both nights available. We thought it would be interesting to compare both places anyway since they both sounded very promising.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would be happy to stay at either place again, they are both lovely. If I absolutely had to make a choice I would give the edge to the Stirling House.
reviews.title: Ideal location

reviews.text: This was our 9th "sister" trip, and my 3 sisters, my mother, and I couldn't have chosen a better place to stay. Clay was a fabulous host, providing great accomodations, gourmet breakfasts to "die for," and scrumptious cookies in the evening. He gave us great tips on places to eat, the car ferry to the South Fork, wine tasting, etc. We even had our own private tasting on the front porch. Because of this wonderful B & B, our latest trip together has produced another batch of memories, and...whatever happened on the North Fork, will surely stay on the North Fork. We all highly recommend the Stirling House for your next excursion.
reviews.title: Quiet and cozy with a knowledgeable and gracious host

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I planned a suprise birthday getaway for my husband through VineTime, and chose Stirling for our weekend stay. Clay was very helpful with everything, to explaining the local area, to picking places to eat and things to eat. The breakfast he prepared every morning was so yummy! This was by far the best B&B we have stayed in, and when we return we will be returning back to Stirling!
reviews.title: Lovely B&B hidden in North Folk with excellent service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An outstanding B&B. The location is faultless; at water's edge with stunning views of Shelter Island but within easy walking distance of Greenport village centre with all it has to offer. The rooms are full of character, spotlessly clean and quiet. Clay your host is charming and helpful in every way. Recommendations on the best restaurants, trips and wines are freely on offer. He knows all the right people and his home cooked breakfasts are of gourmet quality and set you up for what ever your day holds. He also provides delicious complimentary fresh-baked temptations every afternoon and tea, coffee & sodas are on tap. You will not regret staying here.
reviews.title: This place is reason enough to visit Long Island.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just stayed at Stirling House while celebrating our wedding anniversary. We had never stayed at a BandB before but we were expecting it to be quite pleasant. Well, it was much more that quite pleasant. A great location, a gracious host and a gourmet breakfast made us feel quite the celebrities.
reviews.title: A taste of Old Greenport, a gourmet taste !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A beautiful bed and breakfast. Amazing food, incredible views, a comfortable room with a gracious and charming host. The French Room is very nicely appointed, and quite romantic. Greenport is a fantastic town with excellent restaurants (we recommend Claudios and The Frisky Oyster), fun activities and great shopping. We also highly recommend the winery tour with Vintage Tours - this was an wonderful way to spend a day. There was absolutely nothing about this trip that we would change and we are looking forward to our next trip to the Stirling House.
reviews.title: The Perfect Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just 3 rooms in this charming B&B. Our room had a full view of the water.
reviews.title: Quaint B&B in a charming Northfork town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lots of snacks were around all the time and the breakfast was bountiful and delicious.
reviews.title: A quiet, cozy inn to relax and enjoy a romantic weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect location for just a quiet stay, tour of wine country or a quick pop over to the much more populated Hamptons.
reviews.title: wonderful time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we stayed in was very nice with a cozy parlor room that could be separated from the bedroom with a folding divider wall. The room was well appointed with french accents and it was the perfect place to relax and spend a romantic weekend. The breakfast each day was well done and the service was very efficient and wonderful. We would stay at this inn again.
reviews.title: Great Location, clean, great host, delicious breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from our second stay at the Stirling House. We look forward to our third stay. Clay was very accomodating, never overbearing. The breakfasts were very special and the rooms very very clean and tasteful. We loved Long Island wine country as well. We look forward to returning.
reviews.title: Impeccable and quaint Inn run by a friendly and gracious Innkeeper

description: Thank you to our guests! Tripadvisor has awarded Stirling House B&B the 2013 Award of Excellence for the fourth year in a row. Recently featured on NBC's The Today Show, The Stirling House Bed & Breakfast is the top rated waterfront inn of Long Island. Quality abounds and the guests come first at The Stirling House, Long Island Wine Country's gem. Award winning breakfasts, gorgeous views of Greenport Harbor and Shelter. Boutique hotel, with expert concierge service. Vine Time, the total wine experience is both hosted by The Stirling House. Licensed by NYS Liquor Authority, The Stirling House is the North Fork's ONLY fully wine licensed B&B. 06/2011 Vine University - The All inclusive wine making class and getaway has started and has been met with very favorable reviews from their "freshman class". Stirling House provides their guests with complimentary area beach passes, as well as towels and chairs on demand. Wi-fi, i-Pod docking stations, ensuite pruvate bathrooms, flatscreen TV/DVD players, fireplaces, and so much more. You will never want to leave the porch! Better Homes and Gardens, Wine Enthusiast, Frommers, NY Daily News, WPIX TV, Edible Magazines, and Coastal Living rate The Stirling House B&B as their first choice. Shouldn't you?
